om.stdcomponent
Class EditFieldComponent

java.lang.Object
  om.stdquestion.QComponent
      om.stdcomponent.EditFieldComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Labelable
public class EditFieldComponent
extends QComponent
implements Labelable

Standard XHTML edit field for entering a single line or multiple lines of plain text. Can estimate its own size for inclusion within EquationComponents. Default is one line.

XML usage

<editfield/>

Properties

PropertyValuesEffect
id(string)Specifies unique ID
display(boolean)Includes in/removes from output
enabled(boolean)Activates/deactivates this control
lang(string)Specifies the language of the content, like the HTML lang attribute. For example 'en' = English, 'el' - Greek, ...
cols(integer)Number of columns (approx) to allow space for
rows(integer)Number of rows (approx) to allow space for
value(string)Current value of field (text content)
label(string)Label for accessibility purposes; this label will be displayed only in plain mode. If you want a visible label, use a LabelComponent.
This component also supports the forcewidth and forceheight properties that are required as part of size approximation.
The "value" attribute cannot include carriage returns in the xml file. If you want to include these in an initial value then you can use setValue(String) in the "init" function (java code).
eg. getEditField("input1").setValue("1\n2\n3");

defineProperties

protected void defineProperties()
                         throws OmDeveloperException
Description copied from class: QComponent
Intended for overriding. Default allows 'id' and 'display', so do remember to call superclass if you override or you won't get these.

Basically call defineProperty a bunch of times to set up all your properties. If you wish to set initial property values you can do that here too.

Overrides:
defineProperties in class QComponent
Throws:
OmDeveloperException

getApproximatePixelSize

public java.awt.Dimension getApproximatePixelSize()
                                           throws OmDeveloperException
Description copied from class: QComponent
Optional override to estimate pixel size of the component. This is useful for components which expect to be placed within equations or graphs. Components that implement this method (to do anything other than return null) MUST also implement forcewidth and forceheight

Default returns null.

Overrides:
getApproximatePixelSize in class QComponent
Returns:
Pixel size if known, or null
Throws:
OmDeveloperException

initChildren

protected void initChildren(org.w3c.dom.Element eThis)
                     throws OmException
Description copied from class: QComponent
Initialises children based on the given XML element.

This default implementation treats all child elements as components. If you want to include text as well or treat elements differently (if they have a specific meaning for your components) you need to override this method. QDocument.buildInside() and similar will be useful; or you may wish to call initAsText.

Overrides:
initChildren in class QComponent
Parameters:
eThis - XML element representing this component
Throws:
OmException - If there's an error initialising the children

produceVisibleOutput

public void produceVisibleOutput(QContent qc,
                                 boolean bInit,
                                 boolean bPlain)
                          throws OmException
Description copied from class: QComponent
Builds up content of this component that should end up in question output. Only called if the 'display' property is set to true.

Default implementation just calls produceChildOutput().

Overrides:
produceVisibleOutput in class QComponent
Parameters:
qc - Output variable that accepts question content
bInit - True if this is first call in question initialisation
Throws:
OmException - If whatever error occurs

formSetValue

protected void formSetValue(java.lang.String sValue,
                            ActionParams ap)
                     throws OmException
Description copied from class: QComponent
On receiving this call, the component should update its internal data structures based on the given value from XHTML.

Called automatically by framework after receiving a form, when an item in the action parameters begins with QDocument.VALUE_PREFIX.

Default implementation throws exception; suitable for components that have no value such as buttons. Consequently, do not call base class when overriding.

Overrides:
formSetValue in class QComponent
Parameters:
sValue - Value string for this item
ap - All parameters (needed if this item uses more than one)
Throws:
OmException - If overriders need to.

getValue

public java.lang.String getValue()
Returns:
Current value of edit field. For single-line editfield, value is trimmed to be no more than 100 characters.
